title: Drawing, "Decoration of a panel"
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Vertical rectangle. Below is a pedestal with crouching sphinxes at its corners. They support with their heads flower pots from which candelabra rise, with winged half-figures on top supporting with their raised hands a garland and festoons. Three women, embracing each other, stand upon the pedestal. The two lateral ones support with their arms the squrae frame of a landscape. Above it is a floral candelabrum with two half figures. Below, at the front of the pedestal, sits a putto, his hands resting upon two festoons.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Decoration of a panel".
Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1440.
